skill.name: accessibility-auditor
skill.description: Reviews UI components for WCAG compliance, ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support. Use when building frontend components or user requests accessibility improvements.

skill.author: CrazyDubya

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown guidance for WCAG accessibility compliance. No executable code, network calls, or file operations. All static findings are false positives - the analyzer misidentified documentation code blocks and accessibility terminology as security threats.

content.value_statement: Web applications often exclude users with disabilities due to inaccessible design. This skill provides WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance guidance with specific code examples for ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support.
actual_capabilities: Review HTML markup for semantic correctness
limitations: Does not execute automated accessibility tests
Does not check third-party library accessibility
Relies on human review for complex interactions

use_cases.title: Build Accessible Components
use_cases.description: Get guidance on semantic HTML, ARIA patterns, and keyboard support while coding UI components.

use_cases.title: Manual Audit Support
use_cases.description: Use checklists and examples to manually verify web pages meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA requirements.

use_cases.title: Accessibility Requirements
use_cases.description: Understand accessibility standards your product must meet and how to verify compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this HTML code for WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance. Look for semantic structure, ARIA usage, keyboard support, and proper labels.

prompt_templates.title: Component Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this custom component for accessibility. Check role attributes, focus management, keyboard interaction, and screen reader announcements.

prompt_templates.title: Form Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this form for accessibility. Verify labels, error messages, required field indicators, and ARIA validation states work with screen readers.

prompt_templates.title: Full Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a full WCAG 2.1 Level AA audit of this page. Check headings, landmarks, images, links, color contrast, keyboard navigation, and focus indicators.

output_examples.input:
Review this button element for accessibility:
Submit
output: Issue: Non-semantic element used for action (WCAG 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value)
Fix: Replace <div> with <button> element for built-in keyboard support
Reason: <button> provides focus management and correct role announcement for screen readers

output_examples.input: How do I make an image accessible?
output: Informative images: Add descriptive alt text that conveys the image's meaning
Decorative images: Use alt="" or role="presentation" so screen readers skip them
Complex images: Provide detailed description in alt text or via figcaption in a figure element

best_practices: Use semantic HTML elements before resorting to ARIA attributes
Test keyboard navigation manually since automated tools catch only about 30% of issues
Verify screen reader output matches the visual experience for all users
anti_patterns: Using div or span for buttons or links instead of semantic elements
Relying solely on color to convey information (WCAG 1.4.1)
Disabling focus indicators or zoom functionality
Skipping heading levels (h1 directly to h3)

faq.question: Which WCAG level does this skill audit for?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on WCAG 2.1 Level AA, the standard required by most regulations and policies.

faq.question: Does this skill replace automated testing tools?
faq.answer: No. Automated tools catch about 30% of issues. This skill helps identify issues requiring human judgment.

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: The skill references axe-core, Lighthouse, and pa11y as complementary automated testing options.

faq.question: Is user data sent anywhere when using this skill?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why is my accessible code still failing audits?
faq.answer: Check for context issues like focus order, nested interactive elements, and missing label associations.

faq.question: How is this different from browser accessibility audits?
faq.answer: Browser tools inspect rendered DOM. This skill reviews source code patterns and provides implementation guidance.
